intro: Lupinus bingenensis var. bingenensis, commonly known as the Bingen lupine, is a herbaceous perennial native to Europe. It typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, featuring erect stems and pinnately compound leaves. The plant produces tall spikes of blue to violet flowers, which bloom in early summer. Its root system consists of nodules formed in association with nitrogen-fixing bacteria, enhancing soil fertility. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in grasslands and disturbed sites.
